captions.text: The jump cliffs at Head-Smashed-In, Alberta, Canada.

content:
dence for this method as used by Folsom man comes from a kill site near Kit Carson, Colorado, where, about 10,000 years ago, hunters had driven a herd of bison into a natural pitfall at the end of an arroyo.! “The bison hunted by Folsom man was primarily Bison antiquus, a long-horned beast that stood six feet high at the shoulder and weighed a ton. The chief prey of the later Plano people was the somewhat smaller Bison occidentalis and the still smaller modern species Bison bison, the animal commonly called the buffalo.”? One of the, if not the, most famous buffalo kill site is what is known as Head- Smashed-In Buffalo Jump, approximately 67 kilometers west of Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada. Proclaimed a

UNESCO

World Heritage Site, the area has been converted into an
